statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Cameron Jones scored 17 points and had seven rebounds to lead Radford to a 69-59 victory over Gardner-Webb on Sunday.
article.headline: Radford beats Gardner-Webb 69-59 to avenge road loss
article.linkText: Radford beats Gardner-Webb 69-59 to avenge road loss
article.story: RADFORD, Va. -- Cameron Jones scored 17 points and had seven rebounds to lead Radford to a 69-59 victory over Gardner-Webb on Sunday. The victory avenged a 22-point loss at Gardner-Webb two weeks ago and gave the Highlanders (12-9, 5-4 Big South) their fifth straight conference home victory. The Runnin' Bulldogs (10-11, 5-4) have dropped three straight. YaYa Anderson scored 13 points and had seven rebounds, and Kion Brown scored 13 points. Rashun Davis had 10 points and three rebounds, giving him 300 career boards. Gardner-Webb's Tyrell Nelson posted his Big South-leading ninth double-double with 17 points and 13 rebounds. Laquincy Rideau added 13 points. Harold McBride, who had 24 points in the win over Radford, scored five. Jones' 3-pointer with 5:42 left put Radford up 61-55. Four free throws by Taj Owens and Anderson in the final minute sealed the win. A 3-pointer by Davis gave Radford a 36-31 halftime lead.
